content.en: Solute transport modeling: Numerical models and algorithms are being used to study various aspects of solute transport in porous media and aquifers. These algorithms, such as the Flux-Corrected Transport (FCT) algorithm, Fourier transform approach, Finite element method, Galerkin finite element algorithm, and others, are helping researchers understand the effects of random recharge, sedimentary structures, spatial variability, and other factors on solute transport. They are also being used to simulate pollutant dissolution and transport, predict partitioning tracer transport, model non-equilibrium phenomena, and characterize solute concentration in heterogeneous aquifers. These studies are providing valuable insights into the behavior of solutes in different environments and helping in the development of effective strategies for managing contaminants in water resources.
content.da: Modellering af stoftransport: Numeriske modeller og algoritmer bliver brugt til at studere forskellige aspekter af stoftransport i porøse medier og akviferer. Disse algoritmer, såsom Flux-Corrected Transport (FCT) algoritmen, Fourier transformationsmetoden, Finite element metoden, Galerkin finite element algoritmen og andre, hjælper forskere med at forstå virkningerne af tilfældig genopladning, sedimentære strukturer, rumlig variabilitet og andre faktorer på stoftransport. De bliver også brugt til at simulere forureningers opløsning og transport, forudsige partitionering af sporstoftransport, modellere ikke-ligevægtsfænomener og karakterisere stofkoncentration i heterogene akviferer. Disse studier giver værdifuld indsigt i opførslen af stoffer i forskellige miljøer og hjælper med udviklingen af effektive strategier til forvaltning af forurenende stoffer i vandressourcer.
